channel.title: At Noon Midday Report
channel.description: The latest local headlines ... Plus ... As dry weather continues, a nonprofit groups looks to the legislature for money for a cloud-seeding program ... Predatory lending comes up -- again -- before state lawmakers ... The governor is commander in chief of the state National Guard -- one legislator asks him to bring the troops home ... And Christopher Hagen's "60 Seconds," on his way to Las Vegas, N.M.
channel.itunes:summary: The latest local headlines ... Plus ... As dry weather continues, a nonprofit groups looks to the legislature for money for a cloud-seeding program ... Predatory lending comes up -- again -- before state lawmakers ... The governor is commander in chief of the state National Guard -- one legislator asks him to bring the troops home ... And Christopher Hagen's "60 Seconds," on his way to Las Vegas, N.M.

item.title: First News: Unofficial primary results for local races of importance. (listen)
item.description: A look at preliminary results of Tuesday's primaries in New Mexico.
item.itunes:subtitle: A look at preliminary results of Tuesday's primaries in New Mexico.
item.itunes:summary: A look at preliminary results of Tuesday's primaries in New Mexico.

item.title: June 5 At Noon: Some statewide posts to be decided today, not November (Listen)
item.description: On Tuesday's midday report: Our reporter on the ground checks in on local voter turnout...The nation's biggest cheese plant is in New Mexico. What's so special about the state's dairy industry? ... Sen. Tom Udall talks about the senate debate that shouldn't have to happen -- equal pay for women.

item.title: First News: Today's primary will see the outcome of several highly contested campaigns. (listen)
item.description: Today's primary vote in Santa Fe will see who will take the House of Representatives seat held by retiring Ben Lujan.

item.title: June 4 At Noon: Santa Fe ready for the primaries (Listen)
item.description: On Monday's midday report: Reporter Joe Day takes a look at preparations for the June 5 primary elections...U.S. Sen. Jeff Bingaman says passing an aggressive national energy policy will be tough...The Whitewater Baldy fire stands at 255,000 acres, with growth slowed.

item.title: Dem Coss cries foul over Republican support of Dem Trujillo (Listen)
item.description: A Republican political action committee is sponsoring a campaign on behalf of several Democratic candidates for the legislature. The campaign is against other Democratic candidates and some of them are filing ethics complaints over the tactic.
item.itunes:subtitle: A Republican political action committee is sponsoring a campaign on behalf of several Democratic candidates for the legislature. The campaign is against other Democratic candidates and some of them are filing ethics complaints over the tactic.

item.title: June 1 At Noon: Wildfires bigger today because? (Listen)
item.description: On Friday's midday report: A professional assessment of the Whitewater-Baldy fire says that more than a century ago it wouldn't be this big. But why? ... Admissions applications are down 21 percent the UNM law school. The dean explains... Another reason for the cheering you're hearing from Spaceport American.,. Headlines ... 60 Seconds with Christopher Hagen.

item.title: First News: Whitewater Baldy Complex Firefighters hope for further containment today. (listen)
item.description: The 200,000 acre Whitewater Baldy Complex Fire may see further containment today as more favorable conditions assist firefighters.
item.itunes:subtitle: The 200,000 acre Whitewater Baldy Complex Fire may see further containment today as more favorable conditions assist firefighters.
item.itunes:summary: The 200,000 acre Whitewater Baldy Complex Fire may see further containment today as more favorable conditions assist firefighters.

item.title: May 31 At Noon: When the Whitewater fire is over, new troubles begin (Listen)
item.description: On Thursday's midday report: We'll find out about the weather conditions surrounding it and what could happen after the fire is out...Presbyterian Health Services in Albuquerque has been workiing on a way to lessen, or for some people eliminate the requirement that they be in a hospital.... And the Department of Defense has nominated two New Mexico companies to get awards for the way they supported employees who were called to duty as members of the guard or reserve.
